v0.comment: Harmonic oscillator frequency [cm^(-1)], from Eckbreth p222

mu.comment: =GAMMA/GAMMA_p/Re, a correction factor for O- and S-branches following Eq.(9-10) in Farrow et al., Appl. Opt., vol.21, No.17, 1982.

AG.comment: CARSFT, =GAMMA_p/ALPHA_p, following Eq.(12) in Farrow et al., Appl. Opt., vol.21, No.17, 1982.

AC1.comment: CARSFT, ALPHA_P/(2*pi*c*v0*m_reduced)^0.5, ALPHA_p in Bohr unit

GAMMA.comment: The anisotropy component of the polarizability, [cm^3/Bohr radius^3]

NOTES.1: mu: based on the values from NRC, 4.764(GAMMA)/2.074(Re)/(7.38(GAMMA_p)=0.31. The given GAMMA_p [cm^2] must be converted to Bohr unit by dividing (0.52918e-8)**2. GAMMA is in this equation has the unit of cm^3. GAMMA_p is then in cm^2
NOTES.2: AC1: based on the values from NRC, 1.772e-16(ALPHA_p)*Const_Osc**0.5 = 0.248e-11
NOTES.3: Const_Osc: =1/(2*pi*c*v0*m_reduced), where m_reduced needs to be converted into [g]
NOTES.4: Const_Raman: Raman cross-section constant=ALPHA_p/(Const_Osc)^0.5, where ALPHA_p is in [cm]. A factor of 1e-11 is taken out as it cancels out with Const_N when squared
NOTES.5: Many of the listed constants are for reference. Only Const_Raman and G/A are used to compute transition amplitude
